Consult cost center managers and note cost center on docket
Move documents to internal mail for dispatch
Cost center manager reviews content for accuracy
Move invoice to next cost center manager
Send copy to board for further approval
Close invoice and give payment instructions

1.text:
The process begins when the Secretariat of ACME AG receives invoices. The Secretariat then performs a visual inspection of the invoices. Following this, the invoice is forwarded to an accounting employee who identifies the charging suppliers and creates a new invoice. The accounting employee then checks the invoice items for any discrepancies. If there are no questions about the invoice, they note the cost center and the cost center managers on the docket and move the docket and a copy of the invoice to the internal mail.

If the invoice is not in order, the accounting employee proceeds with the clarification with the vendor. Once clarification is achieved, the accounting employee consults the cost center managers. The copy of the invoice is then sent to the cost center managers who review the content for accuracy and note their code on the docket (AP).

If the cost center manager approves, they pass the copy of the invoice to the next cost center manager. This process continues until all cost center managers have approved. If any cost center manager rejects the AP, they return the copy of the invoice.

Once all items are correct, the copy of the invoice is forwarded to the commercial manager. The commercial manager then conducts a commercial audit and issues approval for payment if there are no complaints. If there is a complaint during the commercial audit, the commercial manager resolves the complaint before proceeding.

The copy of the invoice and the docket are then moved back to the accounting employee, who gives payment instructions and closes the invoice. The process concludes with the final step of the accounting employee, and the invoice is officially closed.

Send copy of invoice to cost center managers
Review content for accuracy and note code on docket (AP)
Pass copy of invoice to next cost center manager
Forward copy of invoice to commercial manager
Move copy of invoice and docket back to accounting employee
Give payment instructions and close invoice

2.text:
The process begins with the start event, after which the Secretariat receives the invoices. Next, the invoices undergo a visual inspection, and then they are forwarded to an accounting employee. The accounting employee identifies the charging suppliers and creates a new invoice.

Following this, the invoice items are checked, and the cost center and cost center managers are noted on a docket. The documentation is then moved to internal mail for further action. The internal mail sends the docket and a copy of the invoice to the cost center manager, who reviews the content for accuracy. If everything is in order, the cost center manager notes their code on the docket (AP) and then returns the copy of the invoice. If there are any issues, the invoice is passed to the next cost center manager.

Should the invoice and docket return to the original cost center manager, it is sent back to the accounting employee for further processing. The accounting employee may perform additional tasks such as clarification with the vendor or consulting cost center managers.

The process continues with the cost center manager receiving a copy of the invoice. The cost center manager either rejects the AP or verifies all items and forwards the copy of the invoice to the commercial manager. The commercial manager then makes a commercial audit and may either resolve any complaints or issue approval for payment.

Once the commercial audit is complete, payment instructions are given, and the invoice and docket are moved to the accounting employee. If the invoice amount exceeds 20, the copy of the invoice is forwarded to the board for approval. If not, the process concludes with the accounting employee closing the invoice. The final step involves moving the invoice's copy and the docket to the accounting employee, marking the end of the process.

0.text: The process begins with the initiation of a transaction data request by INQ. INQ transmits the transaction data request, which is then checked by IP to ensure its accuracy and completeness. Following this, IP provides an answer or response to the query posed by INQ. The process concludes after IP has answered the question, marking the end of the transaction data request handling. The system comprises two lanes: one for INQ, containing the start event and the task of transmitting the data request; and another for IP, including the tasks of checking the request and answering the question, along with the end event.

tasks.name: check request for accuracy and completeness

1.text: The process begins when the INQ initiates the transaction by transmitting the transaction data request. This request is then sent to the IP, who checks the request of the INQ to verify its details and validity. Once the IP has performed this verification; they proceed to answer the question of the INQ based on the information checked. The process concludes with the completion of the IP's response.

tasks.name: IP checks request details and validity

2.text: The process begins with the INQ transmitting the transaction data request. Following this, the request is received by the IP, who then proceeds to check the request from the INQ. After checking the request, the IP answers the question posed by the INQ. The process concludes once the IP has provided a response.

0.text: The process begins when an employee starts by purchasing a product and then submits an expense report with a list of items. This report is then reviewed by the supervisor, who evaluates it for approval. If the report is not in order, it is sent back to the employee for editing. Once the report is in order and approved by the supervisor, it is moved to the treasurer and the receipts are checked and matched with the items on the list. If the receipts are missing, the report is sent back to the supervisor. If the receipts are in order, the expenses are accepted for processing. The treasurer then confirms the payment, and the process concludes. If any issues arise during the process, such as missing receipts, the respective tasks are revisited until the report is approved and the payment is confirmed.

1.text:
The process starts when an employee submits an expense report containing a list of purchased items. The employee first purchases a product and then submits the expense report. The report is then reviewed to ensure it matches the criteria. If necessary, the employee edits the report to meet the requirements.

Following submission, the supervisor reviews the expense report. If the supervisor approves the report, it is moved to the treasurer. If not approved, the report is sent back to the employee for further edits. 

Upon receipt, the treasurer checks the receipts and matches them with the items listed in the report. If everything is in order, the expenses are accepted for processing. If any receipts are missing, the report is sent back to the employee for correction. 

Once the expenses are accepted, the treasurer confirms the payment and the process concludes. 

The process involves several decision points including ensuring the report is in order and checking for missing receipts, which can direct the flow back to the employee or forward to the treasurer for final confirmation.

tasks.name: review report to ensure it matches criteria

2.text:
The process starts with an employee purchasing a product and then submitting an expense report with a list of items. This report submission leads to checking if the items on the list match the receipts provided. If any receipts are missing, the report is sent back to the employee for editing. If the receipts are in order, the employee’s supervisor reviews the expense report.

The next step involves the supervisor approving the report. If approved, the report is moved to the treasurer who checks the receipts again and performs an additional matching of the items on the list. If everything is in order, the treasurer accepts the expenses for processing. Once the expenses are approved by the treasurer, the payment is confirmed, concluding the process. If the report is not approved by the supervisor, it is sent back to the employee for further editing. This cycle continues until the report meets all requirements and is finally accepted and processed, ending the process with the confirmation of the payment.

tasks.name: treasurer checks receipts and matches items
